sentences.en: -- The people's victim and lifelong bond - slave , as they fancied her, might say to them.
sentences.cn: 人们心目中的这个牺牲品和终身奴仆会对他们这样说.

sentences.en: Bingley fancied the world was fascinated with its glitter.
sentences.cn: 宾利相信,它的光彩足以使全世界着迷.

sentences.en: He always fancied himself a moralist.
sentences.cn: 他总是认为自己是道德家.

sentences.en: He fancied that they were Eustacia, standing there and breathing wishes of reconciliation.
sentences.cn: 他以为那都是游苔莎正站在那轻声低语地说她想要和好.

sentences.en: If she has fancied otherwise, her own wishes have misled her.
sentences.cn: 假使她有别种想法, 那是她自己的愿望使她想入非非了.

sentences.en: Lily had fancied herself sheltered from inconvenient scrutiny.
sentences.cn: 丽丽当时以为没人碍事地监视自己.

sentences.en: Looking at him again, she fancied he still breathed.
sentences.cn: 她定睛再朝他一看,觉得他还在呼吸.

sentences.en: She fancied he was trying to hide a smile.
sentences.cn: 她猜想他正在尽力掩饰笑容。

sentences.en: She fancied she and Carrie were somewhere beside an old coal - mine.
sentences.cn: 她梦见她和嘉莉不知站在哪个旧矿井的旁边.

sentences.en: She knew Felix fancied himself as a connoisseur.
sentences.cn: 她知道费利克斯把他自己当成鉴赏家。

sentences.en: They fancied themselves in the arms of their own dear mother.
sentences.cn: 他们认为自己已经在亲爱的母亲怀抱里.

sentences.en: They fancied themselves learned and assumed airs of erudition.
sentences.cn: 他们自以为有学问,摆出一副博学的样子.

sentences.en: What he had fancied was essential to my sense of proportion.
sentences.cn: 他原先认为必须那样才能使我懂得分寸.

words.tran_cn: 想象的；奇特的；昂贵的；精选的
空想的；虚构的；受喜爱的；被特别爱好的

phrases.tran_cn: n. 化装舞会所穿着的服装
认为自己（可以成为..）；自以为是（某种人材）
喜欢， 想要；热衷于…；爱好

trans.tran_cn: 空想的，虚构的，被特别爱好的
